channel.title: Int to Int
channel.description:
PestControl.java:374: addItem(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int[],int ) plr.addItem(plr.Mbox,1); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
Well basically, I want to make it so you get a random item when you enter the game. So I made an int[] with the item ids in there, and then added plr.addItem(plr.Mbox,1); to the method when you enter the game, but I get this error.
So basically, I just need to know what is another way I can get this done.

item.title: Int to Int
item.dc:creator: @sheeba sheeba
item.description:
@sheeba wrote:

oommggg I finally got it lol

Read full topic

item.title: Int to Int
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

I’m not familiar with the random method within Private Servers so you should be able to use something like this:

Import:

java.util.Random;

Create a new instance of the Random class:

Random rand = new Random();

Then use it like so:

array[rand.nextInt(array.length)]

Read full topic

item.title: Int to Int
item.dc:creator: @sheeba sheeba
item.description:
@sheeba wrote:

Here is an ex of what I am doing.

You enter the game, get the box, you open it, and all the boxes are going to look the same except I want people getting a random box. Each different box gives you different items. ex… well this is what I have now.

public int[] Mbox = {8110,8111,8112,8113,8114,8115,8116,8117,8118,8119,8120,8123,8124,8125,8126,8127,8128,8129,8130,8131,8132,8133,8134,8135,8136};

case 8119://Dharok deleteItem(8119, GetItemSlot(8119), 1); addItem(4716, 1);//helm addItem(1725, 1);//ammy addItem(4720, 1);//body addItem(4722, 1);//leg addItem(7991, 1);//boot addItem(6570, 1);//cape addItem(4718, 1);//wep addItem(7462, 1);//glove addItem(6737, 1);//ring break;

do you get it?

Read full topic

item.title: Int to Int
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

What item are you trying to add? What does the array Mbox hold? You could use a method that randomly chooses and integer out of the array.

Read full topic

ahh ok I see. But what is another way I can get this done?

item.title: Int to Int
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

plr.Mbox is an array. The addItem method requests only an integer, not an array of integers.

Read full topic
